alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 1:03PM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. Frequent wind gusts between 35 and 45 mph midday Friday through Saturday. * WHERE...Franklin County. * WHEN...From 10 AM Friday to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Limit time outside. Dress in layers and cover exposed skin. Wear a hat and gloves. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
